title: India v WI women's ODIs, where to watch live: TV channels, live streaming for IND vs WI 2024
description: India will host West Indies in a three-match women’s ODI series starting tomorrow (December 22). Here's where to watch the IND-W vs WI-W series live on TV and streaming services.
author: Atri Sanfui
excerpt: India will host West Indies in a three-match women’s ODI series starting tomorrow (December 22). Here's where to watch the IND-W vs WI-W series live on TV and streaming services.
text: Dec 21, 2024 2 minute read News India will host West Indies in a three-match women’s ODI series starting tomorrow (December 22). Here's where to watch the IND-W vs WI-W series live on TV and streaming services. When will the IND v WI women's ODIs be played? The first T20I will be played on Sunday (December 22) followed by the second on Tuesday (December 24) and the third on Friday (December 27). Kotambi Stadium, Vadodara will host all three ODIs. The first two matches will start at 1:30 pm IST and the third at 9:30 am IST. The series will be followed by three ODIs between the two sides, starting December 22. In the preceding T20I series, India beat the same opposition by 2-1, thanks to Smriti Mandhana, who set a new world record for the most women’s T20I runs scored in a calendar year. — BCCI Women (@BCCIWomen) December 19, 2024 What's the latest team news for IND-W v WI-W ODIs? Harmanpreet Kaur will lead the side, with the likes of Mandhana, Jemimah Rodrigues, Renuka Singh Thakur, Deepti Sharma, and Richa Ghosh, among others in their ranks. Nandini Kashyap, Sajana Sajeevan, Raghvi Bisht and Radha Yadav, part of the T20I squad, have been omitted from the ODI leg. Pratika Rawal, Tejal Hasabnis and Tanuja Kanwer will replace them. West Indies will be captained by Hayley Matthews, with all-rounder Stafanie Taylor continuing to miss out due to a knee injury. Pacer Shabika Gajnabi and wicketkeeper-batter Rashada Williams, who made a comeback to the fold in the T20Is after missing the T20 World Cup, feature in the ODI outfit as well. Where to watch IND-W v WI-W ODIs: TV Channel and live stream details Where to watch in India The three ODIs will be telecast on the Sports18 network, including Sports18 1, Sports18 1 HD and Sports18 2. Live streaming will be available on JioCinema app and its website (jiocinema.com). Where to watch in the Caribbean Details will be added when available. Where to watch in the UK Details will be added when available. Follow Wisden for all cricket updates, including live scores, match stats, quizzes and more. Stay up to date with the latest cricket news, player updates, team standings, match highlights, video analysis and live match odds.
html:
Dec 21, 2024 2 minute read News

India will host West Indies in a three-match women’s ODI series starting tomorrow (December 22). Here's where to watch the IND-W vs WI-W series live on TV and streaming services.

When will the IND v WI women's ODIs be played?

The first T20I will be played on Sunday (December 22) followed by the second on Tuesday (December 24) and the third on Friday (December 27). Kotambi Stadium, Vadodara will host all three ODIs. The first two matches will start at 1:30 pm IST and the third at 9:30 am IST. The series will be followed by three ODIs between the two sides, starting December 22.

In the preceding T20I series, India beat the same opposition by 2-1, thanks to Smriti Mandhana, who set a new world record for the most women’s T20I runs scored in a calendar year.

— BCCI Women (@BCCIWomen) December 19, 2024

What's the latest team news for IND-W v WI-W ODIs?

Harmanpreet Kaur will lead the side, with the likes of Mandhana, Jemimah Rodrigues, Renuka Singh Thakur, Deepti Sharma, and Richa Ghosh, among others in their ranks. Nandini Kashyap, Sajana Sajeevan, Raghvi Bisht and Radha Yadav, part of the T20I squad, have been omitted from the ODI leg. Pratika Rawal, Tejal Hasabnis and Tanuja Kanwer will replace them.

West Indies will be captained by Hayley Matthews, with all-rounder Stafanie Taylor continuing to miss out due to a knee injury. Pacer Shabika Gajnabi and wicketkeeper-batter Rashada Williams, who made a comeback to the fold in the T20Is after missing the T20 World Cup, feature in the ODI outfit as well.

Where to watch IND-W v WI-W ODIs: TV Channel and live stream details

Where to watch in India

The three ODIs will be telecast on the Sports18 network, including Sports18 1, Sports18 1 HD and Sports18 2. Live streaming will be available on JioCinema app and its website (jiocinema.com).

Where to watch in the Caribbean

Details will be added when available.

Where to watch in the UK

Details will be added when available.
